proceduralStep.para: Use the corrected pressure value in step (1) (c) and Table 2 to identify the quantity of oxygen in the portable oxygen cylinder.

note.notePara:
Normal-temperature pressure dry is an atmospheric pressure condition where:
Temperature is21.11 deg.C (70.0 deg.F).
The partial pressure of water in the oxygen is 0 mmHg.
For example, for a cylinder with a capacity of 4.25 cuft, at 1000 psig, the related capacity is 57 l (normal-temperature pressure dry).
